title: Quarto Basics
text:
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 4 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()








Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis

title: Quarto Index
text:
#| label: fig-pie-exploded #| fig-cap: “A pie chart with exploded slices”
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
labels = [‘Apples’, ‘Bananas’, ‘Cherries’, ‘Dates’] sizes = [30, 25, 20, 25] explode = (0.1, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1)
fig, ax = plt.subplots() ax.pie( sizes, labels=labels, explode=explode, autopct=‘%1.1f%%’, startangle=90, shadow=True ) ax.axis(‘equal’) plt.show()
